title: Future of 'Boris bus' maker Wrightbus on knife-edge as rescue deal collapses
text:
The future of “Boris bus” maker Wrightbus is “in the balance” after a former owner abandoned plans to buy the business.

Jeff Wright, who owns the factory site at Ballymena in Northern Ireland, said it was “deeply regrettable” that plans by Jo Bamford, son of JCB chairman Lord Bamford, to buy the business had been called off.

Around 1,200 jobs were lost last week after Wrightbus collapsed into administration due to a downturn in demand for buses in the UK.

Mr Wright said: "The failure by Mr Bamford's Ryse Hydrogen company to complete the deal to purchase Wrightbus is deeply regrettable especially after the exhaustive efforts all of us involved have gone to in providing every possible support.”...
